Where in the world is this IP address?

Source: R/crm_locate.R
crm_locate.Rd

Where in the world is this IP address?

crm_locate(ip, database = carmen::ip2location_lite_db1, cache = TRUE)

Arguments

ip

A vector of IP addresses. Either character (e.g. "130.191.166.222") or numeric (e.g. 2193598174).
database

A database of IP address locations from IP2Location. Either a data.frame or the path to a .csv file.
cache

If TRUE, the data in database will be cached for this session, improving the speed of subsequent lookups.

Source

This site or product includes IP2Location LITE data available from https://lite.ip2location.com.

Value

A data.frame with a row of location information for each element of ip.

See also

Other carmen: crm_clear_cache(), crm_ip_to_int()

Examples

crm_locate("130.191.166.222")

#> # A tibble: 1 x 2
#>   country_code country_name            
#>   <chr>        <chr>                   
#> 1 US           United States of America
crm_locate(c("130.191.166.222", "190.115.7.226", "201.248.64.43"))

#> # A tibble: 3 x 2
#>   country_code country_name                      
#>   <chr>        <chr>                             
#> 1 US           United States of America          
#> 2 GT           Guatemala                         
#> 3 VE           Venezuela (Bolivarian Republic of)

library(dplyr)

#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’:
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’:
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

tibble(
  id   = seq_len(100),
  name = generator::r_full_names(100),
  ip   = generator::r_ipv4_addresses(100)
) %>%
  mutate(crm_locate(ip))
